slides.content:
# Investment Decisions

Part 2E covers **capital investment** analysis.

## What You Will Learn

- **Capital Budgeting** - Evaluation methods
- **Cash Flows** - Identification
- **Risk Analysis** - Uncertainty
- **Post-Audit** - Review

## Topics

| Area | Focus |
|------|-------|
| Methods | NPV, IRR, Payback |
| Cash flows | Relevant flows |
| Risk | Analysis |
| Review | Post-audit |

slides.title: Capital Budgeting Process
slides.content:
# Investment Process

## Steps

```
1. Identify opportunities
2. Estimate cash flows
3. Evaluate alternatives
4. Select projects
5. Implement
6. Post-audit
```

## Project Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Replacement | Existing assets |
| Expansion | New capacity |
| Mandatory | Regulatory |
| Strategic | Long-term goals |

slides.title: Cash Flow Estimation
slides.content:
# Relevant Cash Flows

## Include

| Item | Treatment |
|------|----------|
| Initial outlay | Invest at start |
| Operating cash flows | During project |
| Terminal value | End of project |
| Working capital | Investment and recovery |

## Exclude

| Item | Reason |
|------|--------|
| Sunk costs | Already spent |
| Allocated overhead | Not incremental |
| Financing costs | In discount rate |

## Tax Effects

```
After-tax CF = Pre-tax CF x (1 - Tax)
Tax shield = Depreciation x Tax Rate
```

slides.title: Payback Period
slides.content:
# Payback Method

## Calculation

```
Payback = Years until initial cost recovered
```

## Example

```
Cost: $100,000
Year 1: $40,000
Year 2: $40,000
Year 3: $30,000

Payback = 2 + (20,000/30,000) = 2.67 years
```

## Pros and Cons

| Advantage | Disadvantage |
|-----------|-------------|
| Simple | Ignores time value |
| Liquidity focus | Ignores post-payback |
| Risk measure | Arbitrary cutoff |

slides.title: Net Present Value
slides.content:
# NPV Method

## Formula

```
NPV = Sum of PV of Cash Flows - Initial Cost

PV = CF / (1 + r)^n
```

## Decision Rule

| NPV | Decision |
|-----|----------|
| > 0 | Accept |
| < 0 | Reject |
| = 0 | Indifferent |

## Advantages

- Time value
- All cash flows
- Dollar value added
- Theoretically correct

slides.title: Internal Rate of Return
slides.content:
# IRR Method

## Definition

```
Rate where NPV = 0
```

## Decision Rule

| IRR | Decision |
|-----|----------|
| > Cost of capital | Accept |
| < Cost of capital | Reject |

## Limitations

| Issue | Problem |
|-------|--------|
| Multiple IRRs | Non-conventional flows |
| Scale | Different project sizes |
| Reinvestment | Assumes reinvest at IRR |

## Modified IRR (MIRR)

Reinvests at cost of capital

slides.title: Profitability Index
slides.content:
# PI Method

## Formula

```
PI = PV of Cash Flows / Initial Cost

or

PI = 1 + (NPV / Initial Cost)
```

## Decision Rule

| PI | Decision |
|----|----------|
| > 1 | Accept |
| < 1 | Reject |

## When to Use

- Capital rationing
- Ranking projects
- Different sizes

slides.title: Comparing Methods
slides.content:
# Method Comparison

## Ranking

| Method | Preference |
|--------|------------|
| NPV | Theoretically best |
| IRR | Commonly used |
| PI | Capital rationing |
| Payback | Quick screen |

## Conflicts

| Situation | Use |
|-----------|-----|
| Mutually exclusive | NPV |
| Capital rationing | PI |
| Different scales | NPV |

## Best Practice

Use multiple methods for confirmation

slides.title: Risk in Investment
slides.content:
# Risk Analysis

## Sensitivity Analysis

```
Change one variable at a time
Observe impact on NPV
```

## Scenario Analysis

| Scenario | Probability | NPV |
|----------|-------------|-----|
| Best | 25% | High |
| Base | 50% | Medium |
| Worst | 25% | Low |

## Expected NPV

```
E(NPV) = Sum of (Probability x NPV)
```

slides.title: Risk-Adjusted Analysis
slides.content:
# Adjusting for Risk

## Risk-Adjusted Discount Rate

```
Higher risk = Higher rate = Lower NPV

Project rate = WACC + Risk premium
```

## Certainty Equivalents

```
Convert risky cash flows
to certain equivalents
Discount at risk-free rate
```

## Real vs Nominal

```
Real rate = (1 + Nominal) / (1 + Inflation) - 1

Match cash flows to rate type
```

slides.title: Risk Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Sensitivity analysis changes how many variables at a time?

slides.title: Capital Rationing
slides.content:
# Limited Capital

## Types

| Type | Cause |
|------|-------|
| Hard | External constraints |
| Soft | Internal policy |

## Selection Method

```
1. Calculate PI for each project
2. Rank by PI
3. Select until capital exhausted
```

## Considerations

- Project divisibility
- Multi-period constraints
- Integer programming

slides.title: Post-Investment Audit
slides.content:
# Post-Audit Review

## Purpose

- Verify assumptions
- Improve future decisions
- Accountability

## Process

```
1. Compare actual vs projected
2. Analyze variances
3. Document lessons
4. Apply to future
```

## Benefits

| Benefit | Impact |
|---------|--------|
| Learning | Better estimates |
| Accountability | Careful analysis |
| Early warning | Correct problems |
